definitions.definition: an object or a sign that shows the position of something

examples.text: He placed a marker where the ball had landed.

definitions.definition: a sign that something exists or that shows what it is like

examples.text: Price is not always an accurate marker of quality.

definitions.definition: a pen with a thick felt tip
a person who marks students’ work or exam papers
a player who stays close to a player on the other team in order to stop them getting the ball
to do something that sets a standard for your competitors or shows what you intend to do or achieve in the future

examples.text: The reigning champions laid down a marker with a 36–0 defeat of their opponents.
The prime minister has put down a marker for a Washington visit in May.
